Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 10th overall pick, by Detroit in 2018...
Traded from Detroit to St. Louis (B) on 2/24/2018 (Going to SLB: 2B Robert Villatoro. Going to DET: LF Player Compensation)...
Injured on 5/21/2018 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Injured on 7/9/2018 with a Pulled Back Muscle, out for one week...
Had first career hit (triple) on 4/3/2019, off Kevin Lumsden (CHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/20/2019, off Dennis Moore (BOS)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/11/2019, hitting .542 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/17/2020, hitting .563 with 1 HR, 2 RBI...
Won World Series with St. Louis (B) in 2021...
1/31/2022: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,200,000 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with St. Louis (B) in 2022...
1/31/2023: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,307,143 through salary arbitration...
1/31/2024: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,307,143 through salary arbitration...
Was selected to the 2024 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/5/2024 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
10/20/2024: Signed a contract extension with St. Louis (B), $7,250,000 per year, for 5 years.
